author: Reuters Editorial
title: Continental AG lowers outlook due to exchange rate effects
text: FRANKFURT, April 18 (Reuters) - German auto supplier Continental AG on Wednesday lowered its full year outlook after exchange rate and inventory valuation effects resulted in a 150 million euros ($185.22 million) negative hit to earnings in the first half of 2018. “This negative impact affects primarily the tire business,” Continental said, adding that its full-year forecast of achieving an adjusted earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) margin of 10.5 percent will be lowered to achieving an adjusted EBIT margin of more than 10 percent. Continental said it will lower the outlook for the adjusted earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) margin of the Rubber Group from about 15 percent to more than 14 percent for 2018. Continental is due to publish full earnings on April 27. ($1 = 0.8098 euros) (Reporting by Edward Taylor Editing by Tom Sims)
